page.title: 12THE FARM LABOURER'S DAY
page.content: The farm labourer's day begins at 7.30 when he jumps on his tractor and goes to check his 126 Ayrshire and Jersey heifers, "his young stock" as he calls them, for which he is responsible. He must check them for disease, especially of the feet. During the winter, when the cows are in their stalls, he has to clean them out every other day. In summer he has time to help with other farming jobs like making silage. He finishes work about 4.30 and spends most evenings "watching the box". Every other weekend is free to visit his holiday home in Sussex and he has four weeks holiday a year. Sometimes he goes to a party given by the Queen for her employees. He might be either at Windsor Castle or Buckingham Palace.
